title: Army clarifies on Vishwamadu incident: Three soldiers injured
body_lines: The Army said that yesterday's incident at a fuel station in Vishwamadu was a deliberate attempt by some suspicious elements to sabotage the goodwill and the cooperation that prevail between members of the Security Forces and the general public.
They said three Army personnel sustained injuries in the mayhem and were admitted to Kilinochchi Hospital for treatment

An orchestrated attempt by an unruly mob, most of who were confirmed drunk, to provoke Army personnel manning a guard point in Vishwamadu area in Mullaittivu was thwarted by firing several warning shots to the air after those drunk civilians began pelting glass bottles and stones at Army personnel on duty around 8.00 pm on Saturday (18) evening, the Army said in a statement.
Policemen as well as reinforcements however brought the tense situation under control by arresting two suspects.
Two suspects, apprehended by the Army were handed over to the Vishwamadu Police for further investigations.
